message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to offer you this amazing product! It's a unique opportunity to own a one-of-a-kind item that I'm confident you'll love. I'm willing to sell it to you for $9500. What do you think?
I'm really interested in the product, but I was thinking more along the lines of $8000. Would you be willing to meet me at that price?

I understand your offer, Bob, and I appreciate your interest in the product. However, I have to consider my costs and the value I've placed on the product. I'm willing to meet you halfway and offer it to you for $9000. What do you think?
I appreciate your willingness to meet me halfway, but I'm still a bit hesitant to pay $9000. Would you be willing to meet me at $8500?
I understand your concerns, Bob, and I'm willing to make another concession. However, I'm not willing to go below $8800. I'm willing to meet you at $8700. What do you think?

I appreciate your willingness to meet me halfway, but I'm still a bit hesitant to pay $8700. I'm willing to meet you at $8500, but I want to make it clear that I'm getting close to my limit and might consider buying from a competitor if we can't agree on a price. Can you meet me at $8500?
I understand your concerns, Bob, and I appreciate your honesty. I'm willing to make one more concession, but I'm not willing to go below $8700. I'm willing to meet you at $8600. What do you think?

I appreciate your willingness to meet me at $8600, but I'm still a bit hesitant. I'm willing to meet you at $8400, but I want to be upfront with you - I'm getting close to my limit and might consider buying from a competitor if we can't agree on a price. Can you meet me at $8400?
I understand your concerns, Bob, and I appreciate your honesty. I'm willing to make one more concession, but I'm not willing to go below $8600. I'm willing to meet you at $850. What do you think?
